review: I personally do not have cable connected to my T.V. so this actually gives me a reason to use the nice T.V. hanging in my room. It sends the signal to your T.V. to find the item you are watching and play it. It is a really great product and allows you to watch things from Netflix, Hulu Plus, HBO, YouTube, and other apps that are listed as being compatible. You have excellent quality, depending on your internet connection. The device you are using can be used as a sort of remote to scrub back and forth or play something else. It's not perfect as it is only as good as your internet and sometimes when you rewind you have to wait for it to buffer like when watching a video on the internet (it shouldn't take that long though). There is some delay between the controls on the device you are casting from and the T.V. I also get annoyed with Netflix because the remote control will go away. With the HBO I can easily re-access those controls, but I have not figured out how to do that with Netflix without some difficulty. I have had a time or two where my T.V. was not syncing with the app or it froze in the loading process, but it really isn't that frequent to bug me. I mostly use it with Netflix, Hulu Plus, HBO, and YouTube and all from my iPad so that is all I can contribute. Also, you cannot use it with Windows phones because they don't make apps for those phones and most likely never will (some kind of issue between windows and Google). Hope this helps!
